subject: Re: Is it possible to include javadoc/comments in junitreports?
msgSnippet: Hi valerie, ... I don t know about the javadoc stuff, but if you name your test methods in a meaningful way, I think you can get as much information as you
messageBody:
Hi valerie,

> I'm using Ant to run junit and junitreport. I like the HTML output
> that junitreport generates, but I am wondering if it is possible to
> include more javadoc/comments in the output rather than just the
> success/failure status and time the test took to run. It would be
> great if junitreport could include a comment from the source code
> about what each test means.
I don't know about the javadoc stuff, but if you name your test methods
in a meaningful way, I think you can get as much information as you need.

ie.
public void testSuchAndSuchAreSoAndSo() {
// test that such and such are so and so
}

Best regards,
-- Shinobu Kawai

--
Shinobu Kawai <shinobu@..., shinobu@...>
